original_solution_mapping.L1: On the way to the library, Trent went 4 blocks + 7 blocks = <<4+7=11>>11 blocks.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Trent came home the same way so he went 11 blocks + 11 blocks = <<11+11=22>>22 blocks.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5799.
    Returns: the total number of blocks Trent traveled.
    """
    # L1
    blocks_to_bus_stop = 4 # walked 4 blocks from his house to the bus stop
    blocks_bus_to_library = 7 # rode the bus 7 blocks to the library
    blocks_to_library = blocks_to_bus_stop + blocks_bus_to_library

    # L2
    total_blocks_traveled = blocks_to_library + blocks_to_library

    # FA
    answer = total_blocks_traveled
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: On the way to the library, Trent went {blocks_to_bus_stop} blocks + {blocks_bus_to_library} blocks = <<{blocks_to_bus_stop}+{blocks_bus_to_library}={blocks_to_library}>>{blocks_to_library} blocks.
Trent came home the same way so he went {blocks_to_library} blocks + {blocks_to_library} blocks = <<{blocks_to_library}+{blocks_to_library}={total_blocks_traveled}>>{total_blocks_traveled} blocks.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: On the way to the library, Trent went 4 blocks + 7 blocks = <<4+7=28>>28 blocks.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Trent came home the same way so he went 28 blocks + 28 blocks = <<28+28=56>>56 blocks.

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '+' but used '*' instead.
